availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Joseph Monroe Morrison (Grayson County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier)

body.p: Grayson County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to America Morrison. Father of Alice E. Morrison, John B. Morrison, James W. Morrison, Agnes Morrison, Thomas Morrison, George W. Morrison, and Lydia C. Morrison. Farmer in Grayson County in 1860. Served in the the Grayson County Rock Creek Home Guard in 1862 and 1863.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Grayson County, p. 364.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Grayson County, Precinct 5, p. 375B.
KYR-0002-225-0022.
KYR-0001-004-0086.
